text: Suhayl ibn Amr was originally an idolater in Mecca. He was involved in Hudaibiyah Agreement. Suhayl converted to Islam after the Muslim army led by Khalid bin al-Walid succeeded in the conquest of Mecca. He has also been involved in Yarmuk War against Rome. == References == Category:Converts to Islam Category:Sahaba Category:Pages with unreviewed translations Category:550s births Category:630s births
title: Suhayl ibn Amr
